DALLAS- NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell is not concerned about Michael Vick being billed as the host of a Super Bowl party because the Eagles quarterback told him it's not true. He has said that on numerous occasions people have been using his name about being involved in some type of a party and he had no intention of participating in that, Roger Goodell said. Speaking at his annual Super Bowl news conference Friday, the commissioner said he's spoken with Michael Vick three times in the last two weeks about his plans.``

significant news by disputing the NFL's assertion that teams can still use the franchise tag to retain stars, even if the collective bargaining agreement expires in March. The NFLPA advised agents of their view. You can franchise anyone you want by whatever date you want, but if there is no CBA, the franchise tag will be meaningless, DeMaurice Smith said. The Eagles expect to use the tag to keep Pro Bowl quarterback Michael Vick , whose contract is due to expire. The NFL has said teams can still use the tag despite the labor uncertainty

. Eric Schmidt and Larry Page said in an interview yesterday that they worked closely with each other and co-founder Sergey Brin on big decisions.
